title: Calories in a Movie Popcorn
meta_description: Discover calories in a movie popcorn serving, including macros, sodium, and variations like buttered vs. plain, based on typical theater sizes.
assumptions: Large theater serving (~85 g kernels popped, with butter topping); values based on common chains like AMC or Regal.
disclaimer: Nutrition varies by theater, serving size, butter/oil amount, and toppings. Check venue nutrition info when available.

quick_answer.text: A typical large movie popcorn with butter has about 1200 kcal and high sodium.

label_note: Totals mirror Nutrition Facts fields for easy comparison.

faqs.q: How many calories in a movie popcorn with butter?
faqs.a: About 1200 kcal for a large serving.

faqs.q: Is movie popcorn high in sodium?
faqs.a: Yes, typically 2000 mg or more per large serving due to seasoning and butter.
Around 600-700 kcal for a large plain serving, without butter.

faqs.q: What's the fat content in movie popcorn?
faqs.a: About 70 g total fat, including 40 g saturated, mainly from butter/oil.
Yes, roughly 25 g per large serving from the popcorn kernels.
